description: Enumerates Google Cloud Source repositories for a project and clones them locally for code indexing and automation workflows.
disclaimer: This VirtualGlass extension is not associated with, endorsed by, or approved by Google. It may use Google APIs for convenience and is provided free to use. BrainBoost Ltd. is not responsible for any damages, losses, or issues resulting from its use.

sections.title: Google Cloud Source
sections.text: Enumerates Google Cloud Source repositories for a project and clones them locally for code indexing and automation workflows.
list: Output: Writes output files to a target directory and emits structured items downstream.

sections.title: Typical workflow
sections.intro: Configure Google Cloud Source with the connection fields and run it as part of a BrainBoost pipeline.

cards.title: Connect
cards.text: Provide project_id, token, target_directory in the connection form.

cards.title: Fetch
cards.text: Run `fetch()` to ingest, transform, or stream data.

cards.title: Consume
cards.text: Use the emitted items in downstream indexing, search, or automation steps.

items.q: What do I need to configure?
items.a: At minimum: project_id, token, target_directory. Additional fields may be optional depending on your use case.
Writes output files to a target directory and emits structured items downstream.
Outputs are emitted to downstream subscribers in the BrainBoost pipeline. Some datasources also write artifacts (context files, catalogs, or exports) locally based on your configuration.

sections.title: Ready to use Google Cloud Source?
sections.text: Add it to your BrainBoost pipeline and start ingesting.
sections.subtext: Run this datasource locally with your own credentials and storage.
